OVERVIEW: The Crystalcreek series consists of very deep well drained soils that formed in a thin volcanic ash mantle over granitic alluvium.  These soils are on ridge sides and ridges.  Slopes are 20 to 55 percent.  Permeability is moderate.  The average annual precipitation is about 47inches, and the average annual temperature is about 43 degrees F.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Coarse-loamy, mixed, frigid Andic Dystrochrepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Crystalcreek silt loam--logged--on a 45 percent slope at 4240 feet elevation.  Aspect is southeast.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise stated.  When described on November 9, 1983, the soil was moist throughout).
A--0 to 2 inches; brown (10YR 5/3) silt loam, dark brown (7.5YR 3/2) moist; moderate very fine and fine granular structure; soft, very friable, slightly sticky; many very fine, fine and medium roots; many very fine, fine and medium interstitial pores; 5 percent pebbles and 2 percent cobbles; slightly acid (pH 6.2); clear smooth boundary. (2 to 4 inches thick)
Bs--2 to 8 inches; light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) silt loam, dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/4) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, friable, slightly sticky; many very fine, fine, and medium common coarse roots; many very fine tubular, common fine interstitial pores; slightly acid (pH 6.4); 5 percent pebbles and 2 percent cobbles; 2 percent mica flakes; clear smooth boundary.  (5 to 9 inches thick)
2Bw1--8 to 29 inches; light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) loam, dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/4) moist; moderate medium and coarse subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; many fine and medium, common very fine and coarse roots; many very fine, common fine tubular pores; 5 percent pebbles; 2 percent mica flakes; moderately acid (pH 5.6); clear wavy boundary.  (20 to 24 inches thick)
2Bw2--29 to 70 inches; very pale brown (10YR 7/4) loam, yellowish brown (10YR 5/4) moist; moderate medium and coarse subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, friable,  slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common medium, few fine roots; many very fine and fine tubular, common fine interstitial pores; 5 percent pebbles and 3 percent cobbles; very few thin patchy clay films below 48 inches; 10 percent mica flakes; very strongly acid (pH 4.5).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Clearwater County, Idaho; about 8 miles northeast of Pierce in the Clearwater Mountains, about 100 feet south and 1000 feet east of the northwest corner of section 9, T. 37 N., R. 6 E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Average annual soil temperature - 44 to 47 degrees F.
Soil moisture - usually moist year around and not dry for 45 consecutive days during June to October.
Coarse fragments - 5 to 10 percent pebbles, and 0 to 5 percent cobbles for entire profile.
A horizon
Value - 4 or 5 dry, 2 or 3 moist
Chroma - 2 or 3, moist or dry
Reaction - moderately acid or slightly acid
Bs horizon
Value - 5 or 6 dry, 4 moist
Chroma - 3 or 4, moist or dry
Texture - silt loam or loam
Reaction - moderately acid or slightly acid
Bw horizons
Chroma - 4 through 6, moist or dry
Texture - silt loam or loam
Clay content - 8 to 16 percent
Reaction - very strongly acid through moderately acid
Some pedons have a C horizon within 40 to 60 inch depth.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  There are no other soils in this family.  Weitas soils are similar but lack an ash cap and have a Cryic temperature region.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Crystalcreek soils are on ridge tops and sides.  These soils formed in granitic alluvium with a thin volcanic mantle.  Slopes are 20 to 55 percent.  Elevations are 3,600 to 5,200 feet.  The climate is cool and moist.  The average annual precipitation is 40 to 50 inches.  The average annual temperature is 42 to 45 degrees F. and the frost-free period is 60 to 100 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Aldermand, Cool Phase, Narnet (T), Weitas (T), Garveson (T) and Jakot (T).  Aldermand, Cool, Garveson, and Jacot soils have a thick volcanic ash mantles.  Narnett soils have an argillic horizon.  Weitas soils have an umbric epipedon.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained, medium to very rapid runoff; moderate permeability in the upper 48 inches and moderately rapid below.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  These soils are used for timber production, livestock grazing, wildlife habitat, watershed, and recreation.  Potential natural vegetation is western red cedar and grand fir, with an understory of queencup beadlily, wild ginger and beargrass.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Northern Idaho.  This soil is not extensive.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content: SERIES PROPOSED:  Clearwater County, Idaho, 1984.  The name is for a creek.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  The abbreviated ash cap is due to tractor logging and the consequent mechanical erosion of the surface.  Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon are:
Ochric epipedon - the zone from the soil surface to 8 inches (A and Bs horizons)
Cambic horizon - the zone from 8 to 70 inches (Bw1 and Bw2 horizons)
Volcanic ash cap - the zone from the surface to 8 inches (A and Bs horizons).
Particle size control section - the zone from 10 to 40 inches (part of the 2Bw1 horizon and part of the 2Bw2 horizon).

HORIZONS.structure: moderate very fine and fine granular
HORIZONS.narrative: A--0 to 2 inches; brown (10YR 5/3) silt loam, dark brown (7.5YR 3/2) moist; moderate very fine and fine granular structure; soft, very friable, slightly sticky; many very fine, fine and medium roots; many very fine, fine and medium interstitial pores; 5 percent pebbles and 2 percent cobbles; slightly acid (pH 6.2); clear smooth boundary. (2 to 4 inches thick)

(5 to 9 inches thick)

(20 to 24 inches thick)

HORIZONS.structure: moderate medium and coarse subangular blocky
HORIZONS.narrative: 2Bw2--29 to 70 inches; very pale brown (10YR 7/4) loam, yellowish brown (10YR 5/4) moist; moderate medium and coarse subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, friable,  slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common medium, few fine roots; many very fine and fine tubular, common fine interstitial pores; 5 percent pebbles and 3 percent cobbles; very few thin patchy clay films below 48 inches; 10 percent mica flakes; very strongly acid (pH 4.5).
